oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dress uniforms of US generals, Staff and Line Offices (full dress, 1862-1871)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: H.A. Ogden created 47 illustrations of the American soldier from the Revolution to 1888 and received $100 for each work. Although the figures in the illustration are not identified by name, it is obvious that the central figure is General George Thomas who commanded the Army of the Cumberland during the Civil War. The uniforms show the full dress of United States Army officers of the Civil War era.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Thomas, George, approximately 1815-
